section.title: Project Files
section.para: This window is displayed automatically when OmegaT loads a project. It can also be called at any time by selecting ProjectProject Files....

Note: it is possible to stop the window from displaying automatically by setting the project_files_show_on_load option to false in the omegat.prefs file (accessible from the Options Access Configuration Folder menu).
Use Cl to open the window, and Esc to close it. The Project Files window displays the following information:

listitem.para: The total number of translatable files in the project, which are the files in the source folder in a format recognized by OmegaT. This total is shown in brackets, next to the "Project file" title
The list of all translatable files in the project. Clicking on any file will open it for translation.
Typing a character activates the Filter field, where you can enter part of a filename. You can also select a file using the Up and Down keys, and open it for translation by pressing Enter.

Note: filenames (in the first column) can be sorted alphabetically by clicking the columns header. You can also change the order of a file in the list by clicking on it and pressing one of the Move ... buttons.
Right-clicking on a filename opens a popup that allows to open the source file and (if it exists) the target file.
The file list entries include the names, filter type, encoding and number of segments of the file
The total number of segments, the number of unique segments in the entire project, and the number of unique segments already translated are shown at the bottom of the file list.

section.para: The number of Unique segments is calculated by taking all segments and subtracting all duplicate segments. (The definition of a “unique” segment is case-sensitive: "Run" and "run" are treated as different segments.)

The difference between the "Number of segments" and "Number of unique segments" gives an approximate idea of the number of repetitions in the text. Note, however, that the numbers do not indicate how relevant the repetitions are: they could be relatively long sentences repeated a number of times (in which case you are fortunate), or it just tables of keywords (not so fortunate). The project_stats.txt located in the omegat folder of your project contains more detailed segment information, broken down by file.

Modifying the segmentation rules may change the number of segments and unique segments. You should generally avoid doing so once you have started translating the project. See the Segmentation rules section for more information.

Adding files to the project: You can add source files to the project by clicking on the Import Source Files... button. This copies the selected files to the source folder and reloads the project to import the new files. You can also add source files from Internet pages written using the MediaWiki platform by clicking on Import from MediaWiki button and providing the corresponding URL.
